items.description: River Severn at Severn Ham, Tewkesbury
items.message:
River levels remain high at the Mythe Bridge river gauge as a result of recent heavy rainfall. Consequently, flooding continues. We expect flooding to affect Mill Avon riverside property, minor roads at Tirley, Chaceley, Hasfield, Hawbridge, Lower Lode, Ashleworth, Deerhurst, Wainlode and Apperley. Also affected are properties and roads in and around Severn Ham, Tewkesbury. Access to Abbey Mill is compromised.
The Upper Pound gauge peaked at 4.25m on Thursday afternoon, 24/02/2022 and the Mythe gauge peaked at 4.32m on Thursday afternoon, 24/02/2022.
We expect river levels to remain high into next week. We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff are liaising with emergency services.  
Please avoid contact with flood water and move possessions and valuables off the ground or to safety.  
This message will be updated by 9am on Monday, 28/02/22, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Severn at Apperley and The Leigh
items.message:
River levels remain high at the Haw Bridge river gauge as a result of recent heavy rainfall.  Consequently, flooding continues. We expect flooding to affect Gabb Lane at Apperley, local caravan parks and road B4213 at Haw Bridge.
Haw Bridge peaked at 5.12m on Friday morning, 25/02/22.   
We expect river levels to remain high into next week. We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff are liaising with emergency services. 
Please move possessions and valuables off the ground or to safety and avoid contact with flood water. 
This message will be updated by 9am on Monday, 28/02/22, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Severn Vyrnwy confluence
items.message:
River levels remain high but are now falling slowly at the Cae Howel & Llanymynech gauges following recent heavy rainfall. 

Flooding continues. We expect flooding to affect low lying land and roads adjacent to the river from the Welsh border at Llawnt to Shrawardine near Shrewsbury. Other locations that may be affected include Llanymynech, Maesbrook and Melverley.

Peaks:- Llanymynech peaked at 5.3m on Sunday night, 20/02/22. 
The current level at the Cae Howel gauge is 4.1m at 4.45pm on Sunday 27/02/22. 

We expect river levels to remain high over the next few days. We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff are checking defences. Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses and avoid contact with flood water. 

This message will be updated by 10 am Monday 28/02/22, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Lugg south of Leominster
items.message:
River levels remain high and steady at the Lugwardine river gauge as a result of heavy rainfall. River levels are falling at the Butts Bridge and Ford Bridge river gauges. Flooding continues. 

We expect flooding to affect low lying land and roads adjacent to the River Lugg south of Leominster from Stoke Prior to Mordiford. Other locations that may be affected include Bodenham, Lugwardine and Hampton Bishop. 

We expect river levels to remain high over the next few days. We are closely monitoring the situation. Please avoid contact with flood water. 

This message will be updated by 10 am Monday 28/02/22, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Severn in Gloucestershire
items.message:
River levels remain high at the Gloucester river gauge as a result of persistent heavy rainfall.  Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is expected.  We expect flooding to affect low lying land and roads on both sides of the river from Tewkesbury to Quedgeley, Gloucester. Locations that may be affected include Apperley, Maisemore and low lying land at Quedgeley / Stonebench.
Sandhurst peaked at 3.94m on Friday evening, 25/02/22 and Gloucester peaked at 3.53m early on Saturday morning, 26/02/22.   
We expect river levels to remain high into next week.
We are closely monitoring the situation.  Our incident response staff are checking defences and liaising with emergency services.  
Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.  
This message will be updated by 6pm on Monday, 28/02/22, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Severn estuary from Gloucester to Sharpness
items.message:
Tides are no longer expected to influence river levels at Gloucester and Sandhurst river gauges. However, these locations are being affected by high fluvial levels as a result of river water flowing into the area following recent heavy rainfall upstream. A  fluvial Flood Alert for the River Severn in Gloucestershire remains in force. No tidal flooding is expected in other gauge locations. 
This message will be updated by 7pm on Monday, 28/02/22, or if the situation changes.

items.description: River Severn in Worcestershire
items.message:
River levels remain high but are falling slowly due to recent rainfall. We expect flooding to affect low lying land and roads adjacent to the river from Highley to Tewkesbury. Locations that may be affected include Stourport, Holt Fleet, Worcester, Kempsey, Severn Stoke, Upton upon Severn, South Quay, Diglis Parade and Hylton Road towpath. Flooding from drains may also be affecting Worcester racecourse and County cricket ground. 
As a result of recent heavy rainfall, we expect river levels to remain high over the next few days.
We are closely monitoring the situation. Our staff are checking defences. Please avoid using low lying footpaths and roads near local rivers, which may be flooded.  
This message will be updated by 6pm on Monday, 28/02/22, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Kempsey Village
items.message:
River levels remain high at the Kempsey Yacht Club river gauge as a result of recent rainfall.  Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is expected to continue. We expect flooding to affect low lying land and Squires walk in the area of the Hatfield Brook Kempsey. Kempsey Flood Alleviation scheme is operational. 
As a result of recent heavy rainfall, we expect river levels to remain high this week.
We are closely monitoring the situation.  Our incident response staff are checking defences.  
Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses.  
This message will be updated by 6pm on Monday, 28/02/22, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Avon in Worcestershire
items.message:
River levels remain high at the Bredon river gauge as a result of heavy rainfall. Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is expected.
We expect flooding to affect low lying land and roads adjacent to the River Avon from Abbotts Salford to Tewkesbury. Other locations that may be affected include Offenham, Evesham, Twyning. 
Bredon river gauge peaked at 2.84m on Tuesday, 22/02/2022.
As a result of recent heavy rainfall, we expect river levels to remain high this week. We are closely monitoring the situation.  Our incident response staff are liaising with emergency services.  
Please avoid contact with flood water and move possessions and valuables off the ground or to safety.  
This message will be updated by 6pm on Monday, 28/02/22, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Tidal River Ouse from Naburn Lock to Selby
items.message: This flood alert is no longer in force, as levels on the River Ouse are falling below levels of concern. We are monitoring river levels closely and with no further significant rainfall expected over the coming days, we expect levels to continue to slowly fall towards normal. However, water may remain on low lying land, riverside paths, Ings and washlands for several days. The Foss Barrier is no longer required and has ceased operating. We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary. Continue to take care on riverside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. There may still be some areas where flood water is present until it can naturally drain away.

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Ouse, Burdyke, Holgate Beck, Blue Beck, River Foss, The Fleet

items.description: River Severn in Shropshire
items.message:
This Flood Alert has been removed.  
      
We continue to monitor the situation.

items.description: North Sea coast at Bridlington
items.message: The flood alert has now been removed as conditions have eased and tides have fallen below a level of concern. Please see the GOV.UK website for a 5 day flood forecast.

items.description: River Thame and Chalgrove Brook
items.message:
This Flood Alert has been removed. 
River levels have now fallen below the flood risk threshold.  No further rainfall is forecast today but there is some rain in the forecast for Monday. 
We continue to monitor the situation and re-issue this alert if necessary.
Please remain safe and aware of your local surroundings and refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels.

items.description: River Severn at Sandhurst and Maisemore
items.message:
This Flood Warning has been removed.  
River levels are falling, but still pose a flood risk.  The Flood Warning for the area has now been removed.  However, a Flood Alert remains in force for the wider area, so flooding may still affect roads and low lying land.    
We continue to monitor the situation.   
Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses, plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded and avoid contact with flood water
